titles.title: Mǝʿǝraf, The Common of the Office / Dǝggwa, Antiphonary

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mǝʿǝraf, The Common of the Office (fols. 2ra-16rb l.4) I-1) Kǝśtät zä-ʾaryam, The festive Office (fols. 2ra-16rb l.4) II) Dǝggwa, Antiphonary (fols. 16rb l.4-38va l.1) - Table of halleluiatic chants (fols. 126ra-127vb)
Additio 1.

txstates.txstate: The majority of the fols. are stained with water. Fol. 1 and 128 are trimmed along the right edge (about 3 cm). Short threads are visible in the centre fold of some quires (e.g., I, II, XI, XII), close to the head and tail of the codex. Bifolio 67r-68v is detached from the quire and held with recent threads. A hole crudely amended in fol. 50.

bindings.binding: Two leather boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: I(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 9/fols. 1r-9v) – II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – III(8/fols. 18r-25v) – IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – V(8/fols. 34r-41v) – VI(8/fols. 42r-49v) – VII(6; s.l.: 2, stub after 4; 5, stub after 1/fols. 50r-55v) – VIII(8/fols. 56r-63v) – IX(8/fols. 64r-71v) – X(8/fols. 72r-79v) – XI(8/fols. 80r-87v) – XII(8/fols. 88r-95v) – XIII(8/fols. 96r-103v) – XIV(8/fols. 104r-111v) – X(8/fols. 112r-119v) – XVI(9; s.l.: 9, stub before 1/fols. 120r-128v)

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible (horizontal ruling not clearly visible on some fols., e.g., fols. 114-119). Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are clearly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible (horizontal ruling not clearly visible in some fols., e.g., fols. 114-119. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are clearly visible. Structural pricks are partly visible (e.g., fol. 100). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the categories of melody and their abbreviations (ʿǝzl, gǝʿǝz, ʾararay); elements of punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements. Text I-1 Two initial lines on the incipit page; names of feasts and other occasions; names of antiphons and chants, and their abbreviations (e.g., mäzmur, sälam, ʾaryam, mǝlṭan, qǝne); initial words of supplications, antiphons and other chants, and their sections (e.g., nastäbqwǝʿ, ʾaṣmǝʿ, täśahalänni, nǝsebbǝḥo, ʾantä, täkäśtä, sǝmǝʿanni); intratextual musical notation signs (e.g.,ʿabiy zema); the word haleluya. Text II Names of sections sometimes followed by feast names and initial lines (e.g., wazema zä-ʾabunä ʾArägawi); names of antiphons and their abbreviations (e.g., maḫǝlet, mäzmur, śäläst, sälam, bä-5-tu, ʾabun, ʾaryam, ʾǝsmä lä-ʿaläm, kwǝllǝkkǝmu, zä-ʾamlakiyä, zä-yǝʾǝze, yǝtbaräk); names of other chants and their abbreviations (e.g., mǝlṭan, mǝsbak, mǝqnay, mǝdgam, ʿǝzl, qǝne); musical notation signs: intratextual (e.g., qalä ʿawadi, ʾaklilä, täsäfḥa, bä-zemahu) and marginal (entire and elements); elements of the Table of halleluiatic chants; tämälläs signs (fols. 30va l.16); crude frames or lines used for indicating festive periods (e.g., fols. 38vb-39rb).

abbreviations.abbreviation: Some of the abbreviations used throughout the texts: ማኅሌ፡ for ማኅሌት፡ ም፡/ምል፡/ምልጣ for ምልጣን፡ መስ፡/መስባ፡ for መስባክ፡ መስተ፡ for መስተብቍዕ፡ ምቅና፡ for ምቅናይ፡ መዝ፡/መዝሙ፡ for መዝሙር፡ ዘይእ፡ for ዘይእዜ፡ እግዚአ፡ ነግ፡ for እግዚአብሔር፡ ነግሠ፡ ይትባ፡ for ይትባረክ፡ ቃለ፡ ዓ፡ for ቃለ፡ ዓዋዲ፡ ሃ፤ ሉ፡ for ሃሌሉያ፡

additional.cont: Fol. 128r: Genealogy of the disciples of Gǝrma Lǝˀul (?).
additional.tran: Fol. 128r: Disciples (?) of Gǝrma Lǝˀul. (Gǝrma Lǝˀul)  begat ˀAndu, (ˀAndu) begat Ṣadəqu…
additional.det: The note is written in a very crude hand.

extras.extra: - Corrections of Texts I and II written interlineally and in the margins, in the main hand: fols. 6ra, 7ra, 8ra, 9ra, 11ra, 11vb, 14vb, 15ra, 28rb, 37v, 39r, 40vb, 43rb, 48rab, 60rb, 93vb, 121va. - Tämälläs-signs, in the shape of two perpendicular lines, indicating the place where the omissions, written in the margins, in the main hand, belong: fols. 4rb l.10, 5ra l.1, 5rb l.9, 6va l.5, 19rb l.13, 20ra l.15, 20rb l.15, 21vb l.9, 23ra l.7, 23vb l.16, 24va l.9, 25ra l.14, 27vb l.6, 29va l.14, 35ra l.3, 38va l.16, 39va l.11, 41ra l.14, 60vb l.9, 66va l.8, 67va l.9, 70vb l.3, 81vb l.16, 84va l.5, 85rb l.17, 85vb l.8, 86ra l.1, 6, 9; 86rb l.17, 87ra l.8, 87rb l.2, 98ra l.17, 100ra l.14, 104rb l.1, 106vb l.9, 12; 107va l.12, 108rb l.14, 109ra l.1, 109rb l.14. Lack of rubricated text on fols. 72ra-77rb, 116ra-121rb, 123va-124rb and rubricated elements of punctuation signs on fols. 75va-77rb, 116ra-119vb, 121r, 123va-124rb. - Pen trials: fols. 1r, 123vb. - Writing exercises, in different crude hands: fols. 63r, 89r, 90rab, 103va, 104vb, 128r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: A black thread is inserted into the upper margin of fol. 78.

frames.frame: Fols. 60rb, 83va: ornamental bands in red and black; geometric motifs. Fols. 60va, 77va: ornamental bands in red and black; “wild” pattern.
